title.narrative: Environment Programme 2011-2015 of the Mekong River Commission

description.narrative:
The purpose of the environment programme is to create a balance between economic development and protection of the environment through a reinforced cooperation between the countries in the lower Mekong basin. The Environment Programme will further develop and consolidate the results of both earlier and current environmental activites of the Mekong River Commission. In particular the programme will guarantee national anchorage of the surveillance and administration of the ressources of the Mekong River through a gradual transfer of activities to the national level.
The Environment Programme has three objectives: 1. Environmental and social data are used to evaluate the condition of the river basin and to reduce negative consequences of the development in the basin. 2. Decisions in regard to the development of the river basin are based on adopted environment management instruments. 3. National and regional organisations have the capacity to react on continuously emerging environment problems.
During the year of 2010 the programme was prepared and approved. Activities will begin in 2011 as planned.
